description: Has an increased chance to crit.
Cannot score a crit.
When successful, always a crit.
Ignores or mitigates the effectiveness of Protect and other protection moves.
Heals all nonvolatile status conditions.
Restores HP to the target.
Restores PP of one or more of the target's moves.
Damages the user in proportion to the damage caused to the target.
Costs some of the user's HP.
Has a chance to crash, causing the user to lose a fraction of their HP.
Changes the ability of either the user or the target.
Ignores the ability of the target if that ability would affect the interaction (e.g. Earthquake versus Levitate, but not Earthquake versus Rain Dish).
Nullifies the effects of the target's ability.
Changes the type of the user or target.
Changes the element type of a move from its usual type.
Causes the damage category of a move to change depending on certain conditions.
Removes type immunities from the target (e.g. Psychic-type can now affect Dark-type).
Has unique type-effectiveness properties beyond the type of the move (e.g. Freeze Dry against Ice-type).
Forces the target to switch out.
Forces the user to switch out.
Can affect Pokemon in the semi-invulnerable turn of one or more moves.
Will bypass accuracy checks to hit the target.
Causes the user to faint.
Moves whose power always varies.
Damage dealt is unaffected by the damage formula, or the attacker's or defender's stats.
Moves that can have their base power increased under certain conditions.

Moves that can have their base power increased under certain conditions. Also includes, for example, Earthquake (against Dig), even though in that case the damage is technically doubled rather than the base power.
Moves which are used automatically for one or more turns after being selected.
Triggers in response to receiving damage from an opponent, dealing damage in response.
Effectiveness depends on the weight of the target.
Affects the weight of the target.
Calls another move in addition to the move with this effect.
Effects depend on the environment in which the move is used.
Strikes multiple times in a single turn.
Instantly knocks out the opposing Pokemon if successful.
Changes the user to another one of its forms.
Heals the user proportional to damage dealt to the target.
Gives items to or removes items from the user or the target, or negates the effects of items.
Allows the Pokemon to use Gulp Missile on the next turn.
Punishes moves which make contact with the user.
Extends the duration of other effects.
Powers up moves via a mechanic other than type or usage method.
Causes the user to move last in the given priority bracket.
Causes the user to move first in the given priority bracket.
Contact-based moves lose their contact property.
Deals increased damage to targets that have used Minimize.
Removes the target's stat modifications.
Protects the user from critical hits.
Protects the user from stat drops.
Causes moves of the user to be in a higher priority bracket.
Changes the order in which Pokemon execute moves independently of priority bracket.
Protects against priority moves.
Resists moves in a manner different from their type or usage method.
The type of the move is not fixed.
Has no effect in battle.
The stat used to calculate the move's damage differs from the damage category of the move.
Makes the opponent vulnerable to Ground type-moves, as well as other grounded abilities, moves, and field states.
Makes the opponent invulnerable to Ground-type moves, as well as to other grounded abilities, moves, and field states.
Fails against Flying-type Pokemon, as well as ungrounded Pokemon (e.g. Pokemon with Levitate).
